DOC.brief_summary: The investigators propose that clinical pharmacist interventions would reduce the rate of adverse drug events in elderly patients taking potentially inappropriate medication.
DOC.brief_title: Pharmaceutical Care and Clinical Outcomes for the Elderly Taking Potentially Inappropriate Medication
DOC.criteria: Hospitalized patients aged at least 65 years Taking at least six prescribed medicines regularly, including at least one potential inappropriate medication Patients who refused informed consent Discharged before consent could be obtained Cognitive impaired
